item.title: Roy Haynes, a Giant of Jazz Drumming, Is Dead at 99
item.description: An irrepressible force who remained relevant over the course of a seven-decade career, he had a hand in every major development in modern jazz.

item.title: As Congress Returns, Trump Casts a Long Shadow Over Capitol Hill
item.description: The president-elect is to visit Capitol Hill on Wednesday as Republican senators elect a majority leader. His staffing decisions are already depleting...

item.title: Volkswagen and Rivian Form Joint Venture, Deepening Alliance
item.description: The new agreement builds on an earlier announcement in which the German automaker said it would invest up to $5 billion in Rivian, a maker of electric...

item.title: Why Trump’s Victory Is Fueling a Market Frenzy
item.description: Investors have been comforted by a clear election result and are anticipating tax cuts and deregulation from a second Trump administration.

item.title: Bernie Sanders Is Wrong That Democrats Abandoned the Working Class
item.description: The party’s record is clear and strong.
